docs.snippet: President Donald Trump made the case to the leaders of the Baltic nations Tuesday that the U.S. was "very tough on Russia," pointing to U.S. support for increased defense spending by NATO countries as a check on Moscow's aggression.

headline.main: Trump Tells Baltic Leaders That US Is 'Very Tough on Russia'
headline.print_headline: Trump Tells Baltic Leaders That US Is 'Very Tough on Russia'

docs.snippet: Gary Bailey is certain China is trying to rattle Donald Trump voters with its threat to slap tariffs on soybeans and other agriculture staples grown in rural America. The wheat farmer in eastern Washington, a state that exports $4 billion a year i...

headline.main: Trump Faceoff With China Exposes GOP Weakness in Rural US
headline.print_headline: Trump Faceoff With China Exposes GOP Weakness in Rural US

docs.snippet: A U.S. District Court judge in California refused to issue an order blocking Qatar and one of its lobbyists from disseminating emails and other documents that top Republican fundraiser Elliott Broidy has alleged in a lawsuit were stolen in a hack ...

headline.main: Trump Fundraiser Suffers Setback in Suit Against Qatar Over Emails
headline.print_headline: Trump Fundraiser Suffers Setback in Suit Against Qatar Over Emails

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump declared as "dead" on Monday a program that protects immigrants brought to the United States illegally as children and pressed Congress to "immediately" pass legislation to secure the U.S. border with Mexico.

headline.main: Trump Declares DACA 'Dead,' Urges Congress to Act on Border
headline.print_headline: Trump Declares DACA 'Dead,' Urges Congress to Act on Border

docs.snippet: Most Asian stock markets turned higher Friday as investors brushed off initial worries about the Trump administration's latest threats of yet more tariffs on Chinese imports, indicating concerns were easing about a brewing trade battle between the...

headline.main: Asian Shares Higher as Markets Shrug Off Latest Trump Threat
headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Higher as Markets Shrug Off Latest Trump Threat

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump instructed the U.S. trade representative to consider slapping an additional $100 billion in tariffs on Chinese goods on Thursday in a dramatic escalation of the trade dispute between the two countries.

headline.main: Trump Proposes $100 Billion in New Tariffs on Chinese Goods
headline.print_headline: Trump Proposes $100 Billion in New Tariffs on Chinese Goods

docs.snippet: While President Donald Trump has said illegal immigrants heading toward the United States are trying to take advantage of an Obama-era policy that shields certain people from deportation, the program known as DACA is actually not open to new entra...

headline.main: Explainer: Trump Muddles DACA Program in Anti-Immigrant Twitter Comments
headline.print_headline: Explainer: Trump Muddles DACA Program in Anti-Immigrant Twitter Comments

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he wanted to "get out" of Syria but offered no timetable, as his advisers warned of the hard work left to defeat Islamic State and stabilise areas recaptured from the hardline militant group.

headline.main: Trump Seeks Syria Pullout as Advisers Warn of Hard Work Ahead
headline.print_headline: Trump Seeks Syria Pullout as Advisers Warn of Hard Work Ahead

docs.snippet: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe plans to visit the United States April 17-20 for talks with President Donald Trump, he said on Monday.

headline.main: Japan PM to Visit U.S. From April 17 to 20 for Talks With Trump
headline.print_headline: Japan PM to Visit U.S. From April 17 to 20 for Talks With Trump

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump is not attacking the business sector with his recent critiques of Amazon.com Inc but wants the online retailer to do more when it comes to taxes, his economic adviser said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Trump Wants 'Level Playing Field' on Amazon, Taxes: Adviser
headline.print_headline: Trump Wants 'Level Playing Field' on Amazon, Taxes: Adviser
